did.abstract: This collection consists of various documents from the Xavier University Senate. Documents include meeting agendas, minutes, meeting related materials, membership lists, and foundational documents of the organization..

bioghist.head: History of the Xavier University Senate
bioghist.p: The Xavier University Senate existed from 1971 to about 1980.

Roger Fortin in his book "To See Great Wonders: a History of Xavier University, 1831-2006" gives some background on the University Senate: "In the summer of 1970, President O'Connor sent to the trustees a copy of Dean McCoy's 'Report of the Committee to Study a University Senate,' recommending the establishment of a Senate in order to enlarge university governance. In August the trustees approved the report's recommendation. The University Senate, which was advisory to the president, consisted of 41 administrators, faculty, students and staff." (Fortin, 238) The Senate met for the first time on March 10, 1971. "It addressed a variety of issues, ranging from the university's fund-raising efforts, campus life, and athletic programs to academic life, recruitment objectives and budgetary matters." (Fortin, 238) It is not clear exactly when, how or why the Senate went out of existence. The last meeting for which there are minutes in the archives took place on October 31, 1980. John J. LaRocca, S.J., who was vice chairman of the Senate in the spring of 1980, believes that the Senate voted itself out of existence sometime during the 1980-81 academic year.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This is a collection of documents stemming from the activity of the Xavier University Senate (1971- circa 1980). The University Senate had been established to promote more university-wide participation in university governance. Documents include meeting agendas, minutes, meeting discussion materials, and foundational documents (e,g, the University Senate Constitution and Senate Administrative Bylaws).

arrangement.head: Statement of Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged first by Senate foundational papers, second by Senate minutes and papers chronologically, and lastly by Senate Executive Committee minutes and papers chronologically.
